abstract: The ongoing troubles in the debt markets may have rocked yet another major buyout. On Thursday, Home Depot said it is in talks with the three private equity firms that agreed to buy its supply unit — discussions that may lead to a lower price than the agreed-upon $10.325 billion. Home Depot also said it would cut the price it is offering in its share buyback.
lead_paragraph: The ongoing troubles in the debt markets may have rocked yet another major buyout. On Thursday, Home Depot said it is in talks with the three private equity firms that agreed to buy its supply unit — discussions that may lead to a lower price than the agreed-upon $10.325 billion. Home Depot also said it would cut the price it is offering in its share buyback.

headline.main: Home Depot Says Supply Unit May Be Sold for Less

abstract: News that Home Depot may receive less than $10.3 billion for the sale of its professional supply unit helped drive the home-improvement retailer’s shares down more than 4.8 percent in afternoon trading Thursday. But despite the company’s terse explanation that financing conditions prompted the move, we’re still skeptical.
lead_paragraph: News that Home Depot may receive less than $10.3 billion for the sale of its professional supply unit helped drive the home-improvement retailer’s shares down more than 4.8 percent in afternoon trading Thursday. But despite the company’s terse explanation that financing conditions prompted the move, we’re still skeptical.

headline.main: Why Is Home Depot Back at the Table?
